title: Bones to Peaches

properties.name: description
properties.value: Bones to Peaches is a spell that turns all bones up to and including big bones in the inventory into peaches, which can be eaten to heal 8 Hitpoints. Before it can be cast, it must be unlocked from the Mage Training Arena for 200 Telekinetic points, 300 Alchemist points, 2,000 Enchantment points, and 200 Graveyard points.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Bones To Peaches
This article is about the spell. For the tablet, see Bones to peaches (tablet).
Bones to Peaches
Released 4 January 2006 (Update)
Members Yes
Level 60
Spellbook Standard
Type Utility
Experience 35.5
Runes 4 4 2
Casting speed 1 tick
Description Turns Bones into Peaches
Animation
Sound Effect

Bones to Peaches is a spell that turns all bones up to and including big bones in the inventory into peaches, which can be eaten to heal 8 Hitpoints. Before it can be cast, it must be unlocked from the Mage Training Arena for 200 Telekinetic points, 300 Alchemist points, 2,000 Enchantment points, and 200 Graveyard points.

Its tablet form is usable without unlocking the spell, albeit granting no experience. However, crafting the tablet requires the player to have unlocked the spell.

Bones to Peaches is commonly used to extend trips when food is scarce but bones are plentiful, such as in the God Wars Dungeon or the Smoke dungeon. Players may also consider the healing effect of Guthan's equipment as an alternative (or in addition) to the spell. The tablets can be used to save inventory space instead of bringing the runes required to cast the spell.

Demonic ashes cannot be converted as they are not considered bones. Attempting to convert bones of a higher tier than big bones gives the message The bones you're holding aren't suitable for peachifying. Attempting to cast the spell without any bones gives the message You aren't holding any bones!

The tablet form of the spell cannot be used inside the Creature Graveyard in the Mage Training Arena; doing so gives two messages: This tablet cannot be used on bones from the Mage Training Arena., and You aren't holding any bones! Despite the second message, casting the bones to peaches spell can convert the bones gathered in the graveyard, only the tablet cannot.

Casting the spell in the Al Kharid Palace is a hard task in the Lumbridge & Draynor Diary (using the tablet form of the spell does not work).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
9 December 2021
(update)

Bones to Peaches will now appear locked on the Spellbook menu if it has not been unlocked from the Mage Training Arena.

31 March 2016
(update)

Adjusted the delays of the Bones to bananas and Bones to peaches to match the behaviour of the tablet versions of the spells.

23 May 2013
(update | poll)

The 'Bones to Bananas' and 'Bones to Peaches' spells now work on more types of bone, including big bones.
